top_comments.comment:
I know it's kind of wild we have any control over visuals on consoles now but I wish there were more hybrid modes - lock me to 30 outside of combat but go 60 during

A few games have this just for cutscenes but I think a properly curated mode would help a lot of games

1080p with likely on a medium settings and its  still cant keep the 60fps everytime.

What the fuck? 

Im sorry to say this but there are games which ones looks as good as this or better and some of them are also open world and they can do 60fps at 4k (dynamic) on the best quality so i dont think its the consoles fault.

Kinda like a cyberpunk experience here.

comments_since_last_sample.body: It is always funny listening to people claim "stark differences" between 1080p and 4k but then needing 100x zoom on a still image to shows the "stark differences".  Side by side, I can see some difference but nothing jaw dropping or "stark"
Also theres a bug where groot loses his voice, hopefully they patch it
I want a Marvel game where you play as a group of villains and I don't care who makes it honestly as long as its singleplayer with a great story, great gameplay, and writing

So i got a 500$ console with a 2000$ TV to just play a 1080p game 
Marvelous marvil lol
So moral of the story is....PS5 better?

I know it's kind of wild we have any control over visuals on consoles now but I wish there were more hybrid modes - lock me to 30 outside of combat but go 60 during

A few games have this just for cutscenes but I think a properly curated mode would help a lot of games
I can't unsee Mackelmore as Star-Lord....

1080p with likely on a medium settings and its  still cant keep the 60fps everytime.

What the fuck? 

Im sorry to say this but there are games which ones looks as good as this or better and some of them are also open world and they can do 60fps at 4k (dynamic) on the best quality so i dont think its the consoles fault.

Kinda like a cyberpunk experience here.

So, basically two choices : unstable 60fps at 1080p with low graphics - settings or stable 30fps with native 4k and high settings. Wonders me why there's no motion- blur or per object motion- blur in quality mode. Makes the game look "dry" and stiff. But hey, if you don't like both, just don't buy the game, at least for your SX or PS5. 🤷‍♂️
This game is a fine example of the laziness of a developer there’s no excuse running 1080P 60 on a new generation system Especially when even avengers Ran @ 4K 60 dynamic.
Curious. Is it possible for a game that has performance during gameplay and quality during cutscenes?
1/4 of the resolution for less than 1/2 of the framerate. That's usually a sign of CPU or possibly memory bandwidth problem, but what could possibly be causing such a bottleneck?!

Game looks like a ton of fun but I'll definitely wait to play it waaaay down the line on console if it gets a less embarrassing 60fps mode or on PC when I can finally buy one without having to give up one of my kidneys.
60FPS allways.... i can't go back to 30 because i played the last years on PC always 60.... and now even higher. Comming from 80-120fps back to 60 is even laggy now :D
What a joke. Next gen consoles doing 4K 30. What happened to 4K 60?????
Poor Series S, gonna struggle bad later on too 😂
